abstract: Reports a list of scores to Game Center

declaration.code: class func report(_ scores: [GKScore], withCompletionHandler completionHandler: (((any Error)?) -> Void)? = nil)

overview:
## Discussion

Use this class method whenever you need to submit scores to Game Center, whether you are reporting a single score or multiple scores. The method runs through the array of `GKScore` objects, submitting scores one at a time.

[doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKScore/report(_:withCompletionHandler:)] provides a sample method to report a score. The `GKScore` object is initialized with the leaderboard ID for the leaderboard it reports its score to and then the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKScore/value] and [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKScore/context] for the score are assigned. The leaderboard ID must be the identifier for a leaderboard you configured in App Store Connect. Scores are always reported for the current local player and never for friends.

items.description: Submits a list of scores and all eligible challenges.
items.name: report(_:withEligibleChallenges:withCompletionHandler:)
